chapter.title: Sharing Packages Between Machines
chapter.para: Sometimes you want to copy a package from one machine to another. Or, you want to install some packages and you know that another machine already has some or all of those packages or their dependencies. In that case there are mechanisms to quickly copy packages between machines.

For the following to work you need to create a pair of RSA keys on the involved computers. These keys can be generated with openssl (or libressl) via
$ openssl genrsa -out /etc/nix/signing-key.sec 4096 $ openssl rsa -in /etc/nix/signing-key.sec -pubout > /etc/nix/signing-key.pub
The keys should be owned by root and have the following permissions
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 800 Mar 11 11:09 signing-key.pub -r-------- 1 root root 3.2K Mar 11 11:09 signing-key.sec
Make sure to copy these keys, once generated, to the other computer and set the correct owner / permissions.
